intro: Echinospermum pedunculatum, commonly known as the hooked echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in a conical shape. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and often have a serrated edge. Echinospermum pedunculatum is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
